biography.0: I build software. My work requires discussing the scope and goal of each solution, sharing tradeoffs between different implementations, establishing milestones, and deploying high-quality code. A typical day involves optimizing algorithmic and network performance, deploying servers, migrating databases, integrating APIs, building machine learning models, interviewing candidates, collaborating with designers, presenting to management, and researching standardized specifications. Common tools include JavaScript, Python, Typescript, React, Node, AWS, GraphQL, Postgres, SQL, MongoDB, Docker, Git, HTML, CSS, and more. My experience includes web and native projects; government and commercial clients.
biography.1: In my personal life, I'm always curious about mathematics, algorithms, machine learning, and electrical engineering. Current projects include building an image classifier with neural networks and a recommendation engine for matching similar users. When I'm not in front of the computer, I'm likely in front of a smaller computer I refer to as my phone. Pursuing a Master of Science in Electrical Engineering. If your project involves improving economic opportunity, public health, access to education, climate, food and resources, or alternative currencies contact me!

education.degree: Bachelor of Arts, Liberal Studies & Biology

contactMe.text: If you're looking for specialty in web development, software engineering, single page applications, mobile or native development then let's connect!

portfolio.title: Gang of Four Design Patterns
portfolio.description: A collection of design patterns as described by Erich Gamma, Richard Helm, Ralph Johnson, John Vlissides.

portfolio.title: Data Structures and Algorithms
portfolio.description: A collection of interview styled questions about data structures and algorithmns. Read over concepts like dynamic programming, recursion, graph theory and more.

portfolio.title: Data Science and Machine Learning
portfolio.description: A collection of questions, examples, notes, and use cases from DataCamp.com's Data Scientist learning track. Concepts includes data wrangling, sanitation, imputation, statistical modeling, supervised and unsupervised machine learning.

portfolio.title: Independent News
portfolio.description: An quick project to test out a few NextJS features such as server side rendering, hydration, Link components, optimize image processing and file based routing.

portfolio.title: PeterCorrea.com
portfolio.description: This website! A React/NextJS project that uses an agnostic css-in-js library. This project features modern ES6 syntax, typescript, react hooks, ssg/ssr, progressive enhancements, all integrated with a style system.

portfolio.title: The Thinkful Experience.
portfolio.description: An online interview of my experience through the Thinkful Bootcamp

portfolio.title: Inheritance and Object Oriented Programming in JavaScript
portfolio.description: A presentation of a few design patterns and object oriented features of JavaScript.

portfolio.title: A look inside the JavaScript runtime engine
portfolio.description: A presentation of the JavaScript runtime, execution context and async programming.
